sense.name: the overall disposition or temperament of a person
sense.examples: This psychology test is designed to detect personality disorders. Mary's husband has a rather shy personality. Each brand of scotch has its own personality. (figurative extension) The personalities of these abused children have been stunted by their experiences. Teenagers often worry about their appearance and their personality.

sense.name: a famous person, celebrity
sense.examples: That talk show interviews personalities from show business and the recording industry. He's a well-know television personality.

sense.name: the trait of charisma or charm
sense.examples: She's always had lots of personality. Some red accent pillows would give this beige room some personality. This wine has absolutely no personality.

sense.name: an offensive ad hominem remark
sense.examples: The political candidates angrily resorted to personalities. (name calling)
